full_text:
Re: EPSTEIN, Jeffrey, reg. no. 76318-054
From (b)(6); (b)(7)(C)
To (b)(6); (b)(7)(C)
Date 2019/11/07 11:34
Subject: Re: EPSTEIN, Jeffrey, reg. no. 76318-054
Attachments: TEXT.htm
Good morning (b)(6); (b)(7)(C)
My apologies, but I have been away from my desk in meetings the past three days. I received your voicemails regarding the status of Mr. Epstein's personal effects. Presently, while the external investigation continues, any personal property attributable to Mr. Epstein is being held as evidence. Once the outside investigators release the property, we hope to be able to return it to his family as expeditiously as possible.
If you have any further questions, please email me and we can try to arrange a mutually convenient time to chat further.
Thank you,
(b)(6); (b)(7)(C)
Page 2668
DOJ-OGR-00025305

Good morning (b)(6); (b)(7)(C)
My apologies, but I have been away from my desk in meetings the past three days. I received your voicemails regarding the status of Mr. Epstein's personal effects. Presently, while the external investigation continues, any personal property attributable to Mr. Epstein is being held as evidence. Once the outside investigators release the property, we hope to be able to return it to his family as expeditiously as possible.
If you have any further questions, please email me and we can try to arrange a mutually convenient time to chat further.

additional_notes: The document is an email discussing the status of Jeffrey Epstein's personal effects. The sender and recipient's names are redacted. The document is from the Department of Justice.
